If you haven't used swirl before you should
read [swirl's site for students](http://swirlstats.com/students.html) and follow
the instructions on that page.

To install and start swirl run the following:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("swirl")
library(swirl)
install_from_swirl("R Programming")
swirl()
```

After Lecture 1 you should complete the following swirl lessons in the R
Programming course:

- Basic Building Blocks
- Sequences of Numbers
- Vectors
- Missing Values
- Subsetting Vectors
- Matrices and Data Frames
- Logic
- Functions
